title: Quantify and visualize isoform-level expression heterogeneity from long-read single-cell RNA-seq data
text: computePIMatrix() — compute isoform Percent Inclusion (PI) Seurat assays. computePHIMatrix() — estimate isoform-level variability (φ) using moment-matched Beta parameters. FeaturePlotPI() — project isoform PI ratios embeddings (UMAP, t-SNE, etc.). IsoformBoxPlot() — compare isoform PI/expression across conditions optional Wilcoxon p-values. IsoformPseudotimePlot() — plot isoform dynamics along pseudotime annotated metadata bands. Use Seurat v5 objects compatible scRNA-seq long-read pipelines (Sicelore, wf-single-cell…).

what: Visualize isoform percent inclusion (PI), ratios and distributions on embeddings — FeaturePlotPI
title: Visualize isoform percent inclusion (PI), ratios and distributions on embeddings — FeaturePlotPI
text: function visualizes relative usage (PI, Percent Inclusion) two isoforms across cells low-dimensional embedding stored Seurat object. computes per-cell PI isoform, ratio log2-ratio, adds values object metadata, displays:

title: Visualize isoform percent inclusion (PI), ratios and distributions on embeddings — FeaturePlotPI
code: FeaturePlotPI(   obj,   iso1,   iso2,   reduction,   assay = "ISO",   slot = "counts",   name = NULL,   add_ratio = TRUE,   min_total = 0,   col = "PI",   bins = 30 )

title: Visualize isoform percent inclusion (PI), ratios and distributions on embeddings — FeaturePlotPI
text: obj Seurat object. iso1 Isoform ID first isoform (must row name assay). iso2 Isoform ID second isoform (must row name assay). reduction Name dimensional reduction use (e.g. "umap"). assay Assay name containing isoform counts. Default: "ISO". slot Slot use assay (e.g. "counts", "data"). Default: "counts". name Optional base name used construct metadata column names. add_ratio Logical; TRUE, add ratio log2-ratio metadata. Default: TRUE. min_total Numeric threshold: cells iso1 + iso2 < min_total set NA PI. Default: 0. col Suffix used PI-based metadata/label naming. Default: "PI". bins Number bins PI histogram. Default: 30.

title: Visualize isoform percent inclusion (PI), ratios and distributions on embeddings — FeaturePlotPI
text: patchwork object combining three feature plots one histogram.

title: Visualize isoform percent inclusion (PI), ratios and distributions on embeddings — FeaturePlotPI
text: PI isoform 1 embedding, PI isoform 2 embedding, log2(ratio iso1 / iso2) embedding, histogram PI distribution isoform 1.

title: Visualize isoform percent inclusion (PI), ratios and distributions on embeddings — FeaturePlotPI
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(Seurat) library(Matrix)  set.seed(42)  mat <- Matrix(   rpois(200, lambda = 10),   nrow = 2,   sparse = TRUE,   dimnames = list(     c("GeneA..Tx1", "GeneA..Tx2"),     paste0("Cell", 1:100)   ) )  obj <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = mat, assay = "ISO")  emb <- matrix(   rnorm(200),   ncol = 2,   dimnames = list(colnames(obj), c("UMAP_1", "UMAP_2")) )  obj[["umap"]] <- CreateDimReducObject(   embeddings = emb,   key = "UMAP_",   assay = "ISO" )  FeaturePlotPI(obj, "GeneA..Tx1", "GeneA..Tx2", reduction = "umap") } # }

what: Boxplot of isoform expression across conditions — IsoformBoxPlot
title: Boxplot of isoform expression across conditions — IsoformBoxPlot
text: function visualizes isoform expression (PI provided upstream) across categorical variable (e.g. cell cycle phase), optionally faceted another metadata column, performs per-panel statistical comparison isoforms using Wilcoxon tests.

title: Boxplot of isoform expression across conditions — IsoformBoxPlot
code: IsoformBoxPlot(   seurat_obj,   isoforms,   group_col,   facet_col = NULL,   gene_expr_col = NULL,   assay = "ISO",   slot = "data",   filter_detected = TRUE,   add_pvalues = TRUE )

title: Boxplot of isoform expression across conditions — IsoformBoxPlot
text: seurat_obj Seurat object. isoforms Character vector isoform feature names include (e.g. c("Cdkn2c..ENSMUST00000097921", "Cdkn2c..ENSMUST00000063531")). group_col Metadata column used x-axis (e.g. "Phase"). facet_col Optional metadata column used facet plot (e.g. "tumor_cell_type"). NULL, faceting applied. gene_expr_col Optional gene-level expression column name (e.g. "Cdkn2c"). NULL, cells non-missing values kept. assay Assay extract isoform data. Default: "ISO". slot Slot use ("data", "counts", etc.). Default: "data". filter_detected Logical; TRUE, keep cells selected isoforms expression > 0. Default: TRUE. add_pvalues Logical; TRUE, add p-values (Wilcoxon test) using ggpubr::stat_compare_means() ggpubr >= 0.6.2 available. Default: TRUE.

title: Boxplot of isoform expression across conditions — IsoformBoxPlot
text: ggplot object grouped boxplots, optional facets, optional significance annotations.

title: Boxplot of isoform expression across conditions — IsoformBoxPlot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(Seurat) library(Matrix)  set.seed(42)  # --- simulate Seurat object --- iso_names <- c("GeneX..Tx1", "GeneX..Tx2") mat <- Matrix(   rpois(200, lambda = 10),   nrow = 2,   sparse = TRUE,   dimnames = list(iso_names, paste0("Cell", 1:100)) )  obj <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = mat, assay = "ISO")  # --- add metadata --- obj$Phase <- sample(c("G1", "S", "G2M"), 100, TRUE) obj$tumor_cell_type <- sample(c("Schwann", "Fibroblast", "Immune"), 100, TRUE)  # --- test function --- IsoformBoxPlot(   seurat_obj  = obj,   isoforms    = iso_names,   group_col   = "Phase",   facet_col   = "tumor_cell_type",   assay       = "ISO",   slot        = "counts",   filter_detected = TRUE,   add_pvalues = TRUE ) } # }

title: Plot isoform PI or expression along pseudotime with annotation bands — IsoformPseudotimePlot
text: Visualizes isoform-level usage expression given gene along pseudotime, together one multiple categorical annotations displayed horizontal bands (e.g. cell type, cell cycle phase). two abundant isoforms gene shown.

title: Plot isoform PI or expression along pseudotime with annotation bands — IsoformPseudotimePlot
code: IsoformPseudotimePlot(   seurat_obj,   gene,   pseudotime_col,   band_cols = "cell_type",   assay = "ISO",   slot = "counts",   mode = c("PI", "exp"),   delimiter = "\\.\\.",   nbins = 100 )

title: Plot isoform PI or expression along pseudotime with annotation bands — IsoformPseudotimePlot
text: seurat_obj Seurat object. gene Character scalar. Gene name used prefix isoform IDs (e.g. "GeneA" rows like "GeneA..Tx1"). pseudotime_col Name metadata column containing pseudotime values. band_cols Character vector metadata column names display annotation bands (e.g. c("cell_type", "Phase")). categorical variable. assay Assay name containing isoform-level counts. Default: "ISO". slot Slot assay use (e.g. "counts", "data"). Default: "counts". mode Either "PI" (default) plot isoform Percent Inclusion (per-cell proportions across isoforms gene) "exp" plot raw isoform expression. delimiter Regex delimiter gene isoform ID. Default: "\\.\\.". nbins Integer. Number bins along pseudotime aggregating annotation bands. Default: 100.

title: Plot isoform PI or expression along pseudotime with annotation bands — IsoformPseudotimePlot
text: patchwork object combining annotation band plot(s) isoform trend plot.

title: Plot isoform PI or expression along pseudotime with annotation bands — IsoformPseudotimePlot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(Seurat) library(Matrix)  set.seed(123)  iso_names <- c("GeneA..Tx1", "GeneA..Tx2", "GeneA..Tx3") mat <- Matrix(   rpois(300, lambda = 10),   nrow = 3,   sparse = TRUE,   dimnames = list(iso_names, paste0("Cell", 1:100)) )  obj <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = mat, assay = "ISO") obj$pseudotime <- sort(runif(100, 0, 1)) obj$cell_type  <- sample(c("Tumor", "Stromal", "Immune"), 100, TRUE) obj$Phase      <- sample(c("G1", "S", "G2M"), 100, TRUE)  IsoformPseudotimePlot(   seurat_obj     = obj,   gene           = "GeneA",   pseudotime_col = "pseudotime",   band_cols      = c("cell_type", "Phase"),   assay          = "ISO",   mode           = "PI" ) } # }

what: Compute Phi (ϕ) from a PI matrix — computePHI
title: Compute Phi (ϕ) from a PI matrix — computePHI
text: function estimates dispersion parameter \(\phi\) Beta distribution isoform (row) matrix PI (Percent Inclusion) values. parameter \(\phi\) reflects intercellular variability isoform usage across cells.

title: Compute Phi (ϕ) from a PI matrix — computePHI
Compute Phi (ϕ) from a PI matrix — computePHI
text: pi_mat numeric sparse matrix PI values (isoforms × cells).

title: Compute Phi (ϕ) from a PI matrix — computePHI
text: named numeric vector \(\phi\) values, one per isoform (row pi_mat). Rows insufficient data invalid parameters return NA.

title: Compute Phi (ϕ) from a PI matrix — computePHI
text: isoform, \(\phi\) estimated sample mean (\(m\)) variance (\(v\)) PI values across cells, using method moments: $$\phi = 1 / (\alpha + \beta + 1)$$ \(\alpha = m((1 - m)/v - 1)\) \(\beta = (1 - m)((1 - m)/v - 1)\). Isoforms fewer three valid observations degenerate mean variance values return NA.

title: Compute Phi (ϕ) from a PI matrix — computePHI
code: set.seed(123) pi_mat <- matrix(runif(20, 0.1, 0.9), nrow = 5,                  dimnames = list(paste0("Iso", 1:5), paste0("Cell", 1:4))) phi_vec <- computePHI(pi_mat) phi_vec #>      Iso1      Iso2      Iso3      Iso4      Iso5  #> 0.5245752 0.1284286 0.3442660 0.1357083 0.4487447

title: Compute PI (Percent Isoform) Matrix from Isoform Counts — computePIMatrix
text: function calculates per-cell isoform usage (PI) values isoform-level count matrix stored Seurat object. gene, isoform counts divided total counts isoforms belonging gene within cell.

title: Compute PI (Percent Isoform) Matrix from Isoform Counts — computePIMatrix
Compute PI (Percent Isoform) Matrix from Isoform Counts — computePIMatrix
text: seurat_obj Seurat object containing isoform-level counts one assay. assay Character string specifying assay contains isoform counts. Default "ISO". slot Character string indicating slot assay use (e.g., "counts" "data"). Default "counts".

title: Compute PI (Percent Isoform) Matrix from Isoform Counts — computePIMatrix
text: matrix PI values (isoforms - cells) NA total gene counts zero.

title: Compute PI (Percent Isoform) Matrix from Isoform Counts — computePIMatrix
text: function expects rownames form GeneName..TranscriptID. part first double dot (..) interpreted gene identifier. PI values computed per isoform per cell : $$PI = count(isoform) / sum(counts isoforms gene)$$ Cells zero total counts given gene return NA PI values isoforms.
